meanings.definition: To make a sharp, shrill noise
meanings.sent1: The kettle began to risp as it boiled on the stove.
meanings.sent2: The birds outside risped loudly in the morning.
meanings.sent3: The risping sound of the alarm clock woke me up abruptly.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter risped through the quiet room like a sudden thunderclap.
meanings.sent5: The risping of the wind through the trees created a haunting melody.

meanings.sent1: The sudden risp of the car horn startled the pedestrians.
meanings.sent2: The risp of the whistle signaled the end of the game.
meanings.sent3: The risp of the doorbell echoed through the empty house.
meanings.sent4: The risp of the violin cut through the silence of the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The risp of the thunder in the distance made the children shiver.

meanings.definition: To speak in a sharp, shrill manner
meanings.sent1: She would always risp when she got angry.
meanings.sent2: The teacher risped at the students to quiet down.
meanings.sent3: His risping voice could be heard from across the room.
meanings.sent4: The politician's words risped through the crowd, demanding attention.
meanings.sent5: The risping of the old man's voice added a touch of humor to his stories.

meanings.sent1: Her risp could be heard in every word she spoke.
meanings.sent2: The risp in his tone indicated his annoyance.
meanings.sent3: The risp in her voice made it clear she was not pleased.
meanings.sent4: The risp in his laughter was infectious, making everyone smile.
meanings.sent5: The risp in her singing voice gave the song a unique edge.
